page.title: 16Fishing on the Ouse
page.content: Bedford Angling Club owns the majority of the fishing rights for the section of the Ouse which runs through the area. There are four main stretches: Oakley Main, The Backstream, College Farm and Stafford Bridge. Oakley Main - Oakley Main is a wide, fast flowing stretch with straight open banks. The river bed is about 2 metres deep at the edges and slopes away to about 3O metres towards the centre of the river. The main species caught in this section is bream but there are also pike, perch, roach and bleak. The Backstream - The river is shallower and not as fast flowing and consequently species more suited to these conditions such as chub and tench can be caught as well as those mentioned above.
